revised_title: Eyewitness Accounts of the 1750 Earthquake in Northamptonshire
tldr: This article presents firsthand accounts of the 1750 earthquake in Northamptonshire, England, as reported by Reverend Mr. John Nixon, Sir Thomas Cave, and the Reverend Minister of Weston with Sutton. The accounts describe the shock, damage, and reactions to the event, highlighting the impact on the local communities and the need for reverence towards nature and God.
